project1.description: Frontend Capstone: Gear to Peer is a site designed for musicians to store and track data related to their musical equipment. The site features full CRUD in 2 sections & Google authentication. Users are asked to login with their Google account and then can access their Collection items and their Tour items. Collections contain information related to a particular instrument and Tours contain collections of instruments.
project1.technologiesUsed: React, Firebase, Reactstrap, Webpack, Axios, Postman, JSX, Sass, HTML
project1.title: Gear to Peer

project2.description: Tasked with creating an app that shows all classmates within a 'Sharktank' section. Upon clicking the 'Shark Attack' button a random student is taken from the tank and put into the 'Graveyard'.
project2.title: Shark Attack

project3.description: Tasked with creating a Pinterest style site allowing users to sign in using Google authentication. Once signed in, users are able to create boards, that link to the user, and create dinns that link to a board. All information is stored within Firebase and created, read, updated and deleted from the site through API promise requests. The site is deployed using Firebase services.
project3.technologiesUsed: Firebase, jQuery, Bootstrap, Webpack, Axios, Postman, Javascript ES6, Sass, HTML
project3.title: Dinnterest

project4.description: Group project - Tasked with creating a chat page that meets the following criteria: On page load users may choose a character to post a message as. Once the message is entered the user may hit enter or click the send button to post it. The message appears with a timestamp, the ability to edit and remove. A limit of 20 messages appear on the page. There is an option to switch into dark mode and the user may enlarge the text.
project4.technologiesUsed: jQuery, Bootstrap, Webpack, Javascript ES6, Sass, HTML
project4.title: Chatty

project5.description: Milestone project - This project showcases vanilla Javascrtipt we have learned to date. Healthy dinos show in the kennel, sick dinos in the hospital and dead dinos in the graveyard. New dinos can be added and all dinos can be removed. Dinos will be fed and petted to increase progress and go on adventures to decrease progress. You will be able to view adventures in a modal.
project5.title: Dino Kennel

project6.description: Group project - Tasked with building a site of the teams choosing. The team must create a wireframe and project board before coding. Only one CSS file and one JS file allowed for the project. Every page must include a loop. The site must have a complex data structure, dynamic buttons and one form.
project6.title: Pants

project7.description: Tasked with bringing the Hogwarts Sorting Hat to life. Users are asked to add their name on a form. The name is then randomly assigned a house value and color. The end result is a card that shows username, house value, a background color that matches the house and an expel button to remove the card from display.
project7.title: The Sorting Hat

project8.description: Group Assignment: Tasked with allowing a user to choose a random color or a random hex color by a button click on screen. The Simple color selection chooses the color randomly from an array and the Hex color selector randomly generates a color's hex code.
project8.title: Color Flipper

project9.description: Tasked with showing the user 4 category buttons at the top of the page and to be able to filter each card by type. One button will undo the filtered results.
project9.title: Adoption Cards

project99.description: Tasked with building a grid of cards for a company's products
project99.title: Product Cards
